intro: Meconopsis lancifolia var. solitariifolia, commonly known as the solitary leaf meconopsis, is a rare and striking alpine plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually solitary, giving the plant its common name, and it is often found in small colonies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
